text: Gomal Pass () is a mountain pass on the Durand Line border between Afghanistan and the southeastern portion of South Waziristan in Pakistan's Federally Administered Tribal Areas. It takes its name from the Gomal River and is midway between the legendary Khyber Pass and the Bolan Pass. It connects Ghazni in Afghanistan with Tank and Dera Ismail Khan in Pakistan. Gomal Pass, for a long time, has been a trading route for nomadic Powindahs. Two Pakistani rivers of Shna Pasta and Shore Mānda as well as Mandz Rāghah Kowri stream in Afghanistan flow close to Gomal Pass. ==See also== *Gomal River *Gomal Zam Dam *Gomal University *Gomal District ==References== Category:Mountain passes of Afghanistan Category:Afghanistan–Pakistan border crossings Category:Mountain passes of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
title: Gomal Pass
